author: Unreal Engine
description:
In 2023, ARK: Survival Ascended embraced user-generated content (UGC) and enabled mods originally crafted for PC to become seamlessly playable on consoles, including Xbox and PS5. Now, more than 360 million mods have been downloaded across consoles and PCs, and iconic brands like Power Rangers are going in-game via premium mods.

This session dives into the technical and creative strategies that made this cross-platform leap possible, including leveraging Unreal Engine 5 to integrate in-game mod discovery and management. Thomas Williamson of Grove Street Games and Shahar Sorek of Overwolf explain how they maintained platform security, integrated user generated patches, and leveraged Zen Loader for optimal mod packaging. 

Attendees gain insights into building cross-platform compatibility, the challenges of maintaining a unified experience across different devices, and how this approach empowers game studios and creators to foster strong UGC ecosystems. This session is ideal for develo
title: Cross-Platform Modding: Expanding ARK’s UGC Ecosystem with UE5 | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description: Join the Quixel Vegetation team to explore the latest changes to the Megascans plant library on FAB. The session goes over current best practices for vegetation rendering for Nanite scenes and explores the latest UE tech. With the release of FAB, all plants in the library have been updated and now support a wide range of new features to showcase. Come and enjoy a deep dive into all the magic of nature.
title: Megascans Vegetation: What's New and What's Next | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Keith Judge of Tanglewood Games presents techniques for smoothing out the process of upgrading Unreal Engine and avoiding common pitfalls—even for teams that have made engine modifications. 

The talk aims to inform on how to structure your engine modifications in a way that assists with upgrades, and makes the process less daunting. 

Topics include  how to make your engine modifications merge-friendly, easily togglable, and testable during merging; branching/merging setup; automating as much of the merging/resolving as possible (with Robomerge and other tools); updating modules/plugins that have been moved (e.g. from Experimental to Production); third-party plugins; dealing with deprecation warnings; integrating cherry-picked changes from Epic; and using commandlets to resave assets for the new engine version.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#EngineUpgrades, #TanglewoodGames, #Robomerge, #UnrealEngine, #UE
title: Taking the Pain Out of Engine Upgrades | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, we get animators up to speed on the slate of animation tools available in Unreal Engine, running though the standard list of things every animator needs to have, and all the things that animators didn't know they needed (and some that you can only find in Unreal Engine). 

The emphasis is on how animating in engine closes the loop of having to go in and out of a DCC, and how the tools available are comparable or better than other DCCs out of the box.

Learn more about animating in Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com/uses/animation

#Animation, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Animation Authoring in Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Unreal Engine's Gameplay Ability System (GAS) is a powerful framework for creating player and NPC abilities. Abilities can include movement like dashing, vaulting, climbing, and using grappling hooks. 

In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, we look at networked movement in Unreal Engine by combining GAS and the Character Movement Component (CMC), and best practices for combining the two systems for control over movement prediction, correction, and resimulation. 

The session includes a demonstration with examples of networked movement abilities.

Learn more about the Gameplay Ability System in Unreal Engine here: dev.epicgames.com/documentation/unreal-engine/gameplay-ability-system-for-unreal-engine

#GameplayAbilitySystem, #CharacterMovementComponent, #NPCs, #NetworkedMovement, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Best Practices for Networked Movement Abilities | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Card games involve a large amount of interconnected data. A single name for a status or a card can be referenced from many different points in the game, which can become a major issue if changes are needed later. This complexity only grows further when localization into multiple languages is involved. 

In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali, Chutpisit Spawasu of Barking Kitten Interactive covers strategies for managing this kind of data using free tools like Google Sheets; organizing localization folders by locale; setting up a glossary system; importing large volumes of localized content through portable object (PO) files; and building Unreal Motion Graphics (UMG) interfaces to handle the localized data effectively.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#CardGames, #UnrealMotionGraphics, #BarkingKittenInteractive, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Dealing with Localized Keywords in Card Games | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Mod Ratchata from M2 Animation gives a behind-the-scenes look at how the studio transitioned from pre-rendered production to real time. 
 
Watch to find out about the risks M2 Animation took, the challenges that came up during production, and how the team figured out solutions along the way.

Topics covered include moving from Redshift to Unreal Engine, with artist and director perspectives on shifting to real-time rendering; communication insights around building a user-friendly startup kit to onboard new artists; learnings on workflow, from asset creation to shot assembly in a real-time pipeline; and of course, challenges faced and key lessons learned along the way.

Learn more about animating in Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com/uses/animation

#Animation, #M2Animation, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Building Real-Time Cinematics at M2 Animation | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Victor Careil shares the many techniques Voxel Plugin uses to extend Unreal Engine without making source changes. He also shares tips and tricks to quickly navigate Unreal Engine’s large codebase.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#VoxelPlugin, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Lessons From a Plugin Developer: How to Extend UE When You’re Not Epic | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Unreal Engine 5 is packed with tools and features designed to help technical designers streamline their processes and empower their teams. 
 
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Sam Bass of Epic Games provides a design-oriented excursion through the latest and greatest Unreal Engine features and tools, tackling everything from camera management to Blueprint tools, State Tree, GAS channels, Gameplay Effects, Enhanced Input, and more as he builds out an example game.

Learn more about building games in Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com/uses/indie-games

#GameDesign, #BlueprintVisualScripting, #StateTree, #GameplayAbilitySystem, #GameplayEffects, #EnhancedInput, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: 2025 Tech Designers Toolkit | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Adrienne Pugh of Epic Games showcases a rapid-fire series of five-minute operations you can do to improve your UI using UMG (Unreal Motion Graphics UI Designer). 

Topics covered include tips, tricks, and settings to make UI development easier in UMG, and to a higher quality.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#UnrealMotionGraphicsUIDesigner, #UserInterface, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: 5-Minute Operations to Improve Your UI | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Mushogenshin Media introduces non-programmers to Verse using fun illustrations and plain language. 

Verse is a programming language created by Epic Games to script gameplay and customize devices within Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN)

Watch this video to learn what Verse has to offer; what you can and can't do in Verse; how it differs from other languages; and Verse's backstory, going back many decades.

Learn more about UEFN here: unrealengine.com/uses/uefn-unreal-editor-for-fortnite

#Verse, #MushogenshinMedia, #Devices, #Scripting, #Programming, #UnrealEditorForFortnite, #UEFN, #Fortnite, #UnrealFestBali
title: A Childlike Perspective of the Verse Programming Language | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, we explore how to automate performance testing for games built in Unreal Engine.  

As tech artists, we love to analyze the performance of our games, and we want to be able to automate the process of gathering that data, right? Automation leads to consistency, and consistency can be used to measure the impact of specific changes or catch regressions. 

There’s a few different ways that tech artists can lead the charge in automating this process, and in this talk we discuss options for automating performance testing from quick and easy to robust, configurable, and extensible.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#TechArt, #PerformanceTesting, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: A Tech Artist's Guide to Automated Performance Testing | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, we focus on the iteration and editing process for animation in Unreal Engine, exploring what you can do as an animator using UE with production-style examples.

Learn more about animating in Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com/uses/animation

#Animation, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Animation Editing In Unreal Engine | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Unreal Engine has great tools for multi-platform development, but developers use various methods to achieve the best performance and quality on each platform, from PC to Nintendo Switch. 

In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Epic Games Japan shares the multi-platform development know-how we have gained through various domestic titles. Please note that mobile platform scalability is not covered in this session.

Learn more about making games in Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com/uses/indie-games

#GameDevelopment, #Japan, #MultiPlatformGames, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #UnrealFestBali
title: Beyond Scalability: Multi-Platform Insights From Japan | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Throughout Unreal Engine development, complex technical challenges are inevitable. From running into performance bottlenecks to unexpected engine behavior, knowing how to efficiently identify, validate, and resolve these issues is critical for maintaining a stable production.
 
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Thomas Sheppard shares Prismatic Studios’ approach to problem identification and solution, covering strategies for gathering data, recognizing patterns, and avoiding false assumptions. He then takes a look at validation techniques, using profiling tools and debugging methods to confirm issues before implementing fixes.
 
Next, Thomas discusses risk assessment and resolution strategies, focusing on minimizing disruptions when making changes to the codebase. Using real-world examples, including both Unreal Developer Network (UDN) cases and challenges the studio has faced in client projects, he shows how to diagnose and solve complex issues effectively.
 
Watch fo
title: Breaking (and Fixing) Unreal: An Engineer’s Guide to Problem-Solving | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Christophe Bardoux of M2 Animation showcases how his team extended a traditional CG studio pipeline to integrate Unreal Engine at its core using the power of Python.

He covers how and why M2 brought Unreal Engine into an existing pipeline that was built around Maya and managed through a Python-based API and ShotGrid. He also gives an insight into how the studio uses Unreal Engine for production, with animation taking place in Maya and UE used for setdressing, lighting, and VFX.
 
Christophe then introduces a series of custom tools M2 created to streamline the export of assets from Maya to Unreal Engine, and also tools for automatic shot management, including for building levels and sequences automatically based on Shot Grid data.

He explains how to leverage level streaming and sub-sequences to make a per-shot pipeline in which artists can work together easily, and demonstrates how the studio’s rendering is handled through Unreal Eng
title: Bringing Unreal Engine into a Classic CG Pipeline with Python | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali 2025, Aidan Newsome of Bienenstock Natural Playgrounds shares how he uses RealityCapture to quickly build high-quality 3D assets that don’t just look good, but actually work in CAD tools like Rhino. And yes, these models are carved in the real world by artists wielding chainsaws! 

The session also walks through the process of taking photogrammetry data from a drone, processing it in RealityCapture, and turning it into an accurate site model. 

Start with a solid design and all the right ingredients in place, and it all comes together using innovative landscape architecture plugins to shape natural playscapes, sometimes spanning beyond 20 acres. 

Newsome concludes by bringing it all into Twinmotion to create immersive, highly realistic visuals and animations. It’s a fast, flexible workflow that combines real-world accuracy with creative freedom.

Learn more about Twinmotion here: twinmotion.com

#RealityScan, #Twinmotion, #Photogrammetry,
title: Carving Reality: From Chainsaws to Digital Landscapes | Unreal Fest Bali 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Mutable is an Unreal Engine plugin that generates dynamic skeletal meshes, materials, and textures at runtime. It can be used for creating everything from character customization systems to dynamic content like vehicles, weapons, props, and more.  

In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Bali, Epic Games’ Dustin DeVoe shows how Mutable can support customizing anything in your game to create efficient meshes across characters, weapons, vehicles, and environment pieces.  

Getting started with Mutable can be daunting, but teams have an opportunity to create efficient pipelines and content using it. 

This talk aims to demonstrate the advantages of Mutable as a tool and show why embracing it is a good idea.  DeVoe provides practical examples of how Mutable can be used across various types of content, with a light touch on different areas of the tool to get started with it.

Learn more about using Mutable in Unreal Engine here: dev.epicgames.com/documentation/unreal-engine/mutable-overvi
title: Customize Anything: Embracing Mutable | Unreal Fest Bali 2025
